required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase IV Study of the Onset and Maintenance of the Antiplatelet Effect of Ticagrelor Compared With Clopidogrel in Chinese Patients With ACS
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicentre, Open-label, Randomized, 6-week, Phase IV Study of the Onset and Maintenance of the Antiplatelet Effect of Ticagrelor Compared With Clopidogrel With Aspirin as Background Therapy in Chinese Patients With Non-ST or ST Elevation Acute Coronary Syndromes (ACS)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test the hypothesis that the onset of the antiplatelet effect of ticagrelor is more rapid and greater than clopidogrel in Chinese patients with ACS.

primary_outcome.measure: the Percentage Inhibition of the P2Y12 Receptor
primary_outcome.time_frame: at 2 hours after first dose of study drug
primary_outcome.description: Note: the primary endpoint was changed per the statistical analysis plan prior database lock.

secondary_outcome.measure: the Percentage Inhibition of the P2Y12 Receptor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 0.5 hour after first dose of study drug

secondary_outcome.measure: the Percentage Inhibition of the P2Y12 Receptor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 8 hours after first dose of study drug

secondary_outcome.measure: the Percentage Inhibition of the P2Y12 Receptor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 24 hours after first dose of study drug

secondary_outcome.measure: the Percentage Inhibition of the P2Y12 Receptor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 6 weeks after first dose of study drug

clinical_study.condition: Non-ST or ST Elevation Acute Coronary Syndromes

intervention.description: 90mg tablets. loading dose of 180mg ticagrelor tablets (two 90mg tablets) taken orally, followed by 90mg of ticagrelor 12 hours after the first dose. Duration of treatment: 6 weeks.
75mg capsule. loading dose of 600mg clopidogrel capsules (eight 75mg capsules) taken orally, follow by 75mg of clopidogrel capsules orally od. Duration of treatment: 6 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1. Provision of informed consent prior to any study specific procedures
- 2. Female or male aged at least 18 years
- 3. Females of child-bearing potential must have a negative urine pregnancy test at enrolment and be willing to use reliable contraception
- 4. Index event of non-ST or ST segment elevation ACS.
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1.Contraindication or other reason that clopidogrel or ticagrelor should not be administered (eg, hypersensitivity, active bleeding, moderate or severe liver disease, history of previous intracranial bleed, GI bleed within the past 6 months, major surgery within 30 days)
- 2. Oral anticoagulation therapy or GP IIb/IIIa receptor antagonists therapy within 30 days prior to randomisation or cannot be stopped
- 3. Ticagrelor or clopidogrel or other P2Y12 inhibitors within 14 days prior to randomisation
- 4. Requires dialysis
- 5. Nonselective non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) and prostacyclins (PGI2) therapy that cannot be stopped

overall_official.affiliation: The General Hospital of People's Liberation Army

clinical_study.keyword: Non-ST or ST Elevation Acute Coronary Syndromes, Ticagrelor, Clopidogrel, Antiplatelet Effect

participant_flow.recruitment_details: First subject enrolled: 15/05/2013, Last subject last visit: 18/03/2014. There were 5 study centers in China, which participated this study.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: There was no run-in or any other pre-assignment periods following participant enrollment.

group.title: Ticagrelor
group.description: Patients received a loading dose of 180mg ticagrelor tablets (two 90mg tablets) taken orally, followed by 90mg of ticagrelor 12 hours after the first dose. The third dose of ticagrelor was given to patients after the blood sample had been obtained 24 hours after the first dose. Thereafter, the patients took 90mg of ticagrelor orally bd. The total study period was 6 weeks.

group.title: Clopidogrel
group.description: Patients received a loading dose of 600mg clopidogrel tablets (eight 75mg tablets) taken orally. The second dose of clopidogrel had been given to patients after the blood sample had been obtained 24 hours after the first dose. Thereafter, the patients took 75mg of clopidogrel orally od. The total study period was 6 weeks.

baseline.population: Three randomized patients were excluded from the full analysis set (FAS) due to any of the following reasons: 1) did not meet exclusion requirments but was randomized, 2)post-treatment blood PRU was not available, 3) pre-treatment blood PRU was missing, and 4) use of prohibited medications.

group.title: Ticagrelor
group.description: Patients received a loading dose of 180mg ticagrelor tablets (two 90mg tablets) taken orally, followed by 90mg of ticagrelor 12 hours after the first dose. The third dose of ticagrelor was given to patients after the blood sample had been obtained 24 hours after the first dose. Thereafter, the patients took 90mg of ticagrelor orally bd. The total study period was 6 weeks.

group.description: Patients received a loading dose of 600mg clopidogrel tablets (eight 75mg tablets) taken orally. The second dose of clopidogrel had been given to patients after the blood sample had been obtained 24 hours after the first dose. Thereafter, the patients took 75mg of clopidogrel orally od. The total study period was 6 weeks.

measure.title: the Percentage Inhibition of the P2Y12 Receptor
measure.description: Note: the primary endpoint was changed per the statistical analysis plan prior database lock.
measure.population: FAS (full analysis set). Three randomized patients were excluded from FAS due to any of the following reasons: 1) did not meet exclusion requirments but was randomized, 2)post-treatment blood PRU was not available, 3) pre-treatment blood PRU was missing, and 4) use of prohibited medications.

analysis.p_value_desc: not adjusted for multiple comparisons. statistical significance level: 0.05

outcome.title: the Percentage Inhibition of the P2Y12 Receptor
outcome.time_frame: at 0.5 hour after first dose of study drug
outcome.population: PPS (per-protocol set). Seven randomized patients were excluded from PPS due to any of the following reasons: 1) did not meet exclusion requirments but was randomized, 2)post-treatment blood PRU was not available, 3) pre-treatment blood PRU was missing, 4) missing blood PRU at 2h after first dose, and 5) use of prohibited medications.

reported_events.time_frame: 6 weeks for all AEs and another 14 days for SAEs.

group.description: Patients received a loading dose of 180mg ticagrelor tablets (two 90mg tablets) taken orally, followed by 90mg of ticagrelor 12 hours after the first dose. certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: (1) Sample size was relatively small. (2) Study duration with 6 weeks seemed limited. (3) Sampling time-points seemed relatively scarce, such as missing the time point for 1-hour and 4-hour after loading dose.
